thread.title: Robin van Persie's own goal sinks Netherlands
thread.title_full: Robin van Persie's own goal sinks Netherlands - UPI.com

author: upi.com
title: Robin van Persie's own goal sinks Netherlands
text:
| License Photo EINDHOVEN, Netherlands, Oct. 13 (UPI) -- One of the Netherlands' best could also be the reason the Dutch wont be at Euro 2016.
Striker Robin van Persie , on as a substitute in the 38th minute, headed in an own goal to give the Czech Republic a 3-1 advantage. The Dutch lost 3-2 Tuesday at PSV Philips Stadium in Eindhoven.
Following the own goal and a Klaas-Jan Huntelaar score, van Persie, 32, netted a score in the opponent's goal.
But the own goal was the decisive blow for the Dutch. The Dutch still needed Turkey to lose to Iceland to clinch third place and a playoff spot in Group A.
G ROBİN VAN PERSİE KENDİ KALESİNE ÇOK GÜZEL BİR GOL ATIYOR pic.twitter.com/mEDHlcbjI0 
— Aslan'ın Maçı Var (@Aslaninmacivar_) October 13, 2015 The Dutch played with 10 men after Merek Suchy was sent off the field before halftime.
On van Persie's sorrowful shot, the striker brought down a cross with his head, beat his own keeper, and knocked the ball back into his own net.
RELATED Pele prefers Lionel Messi to Cristiano Ronaldo In 2014, van Persie netted 14 goals and had three assists in 34 games for the Netherlands and Manchester United.
